import numpy as np # linear algebra

    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.165d2a01:
mypalette=sns.color_palette('GnBu_d', 40)
plt.figure(figsize=(20,10))
sns.countplot(y=df['company'],order=df['company'].value_counts().index, palette=mypalette)
plt.ylabel('Company Name', fontsize=14)
plt.xlabel('Number of Job postings', fontsize=14)
plt.title("Companies with most job postings", fontsize=18)
plt.ylim(20.5,-0.5)
plt.show()
source.f79867d6:
mypalette=sns.color_palette('GnBu_d', 40)
plt.figure(figsize=(20,10))
sns.countplot(y=df['jobtitle'],order=df['jobtitle'].value_counts().index, palette=mypalette)
plt.ylabel('Name of the jobtitle', fontsize=(14))
plt.xlabel('Companies with most jobtitle',fontsize=14)
plt.title("Companies with most jobtitle", fontsize=18)
plt.ylim(20.5,-0.5)
plt.show()
source.47080b42:
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize']=(10,5)
df['jobstatus'].value_counts().sort_values(ascending=False).head(5).plot.bar(color='pink')
plt.title(' top 5 jobs ')
plt.xlabel('countries')
plt.ylabel('count')
plt.show()
source.7f47e71e:
# use pie for first top 5 shif time 
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize']=(10,5)
df['shift'].value_counts().sort_values(ascending=True).head(5).plot.pie(y='shift',autopct="%0.1f%%")
plt.title('number of the shift')
plt.xlabel('shift')
plt.ylabel('counts')
plt.show()
